item.title: Trains and the Buddhist principle of impermanence
item.description: The Buddhist principle of impermanence, where everything in life is constantly changing, and nothing is permanent. Even something as grand and impressive as a train is also subject to this. Despite this, trains are crucial in connecting people and places, providing transportation essential to our society.
item.content:encoded: Imagine you are traveling on a train through the rural parts of India. Apart from the fields and beautiful views for the most part, the following two common sights are that of shacks and railway crossings. As we pass an intersection, I either mindlessly stare outside or look at everything around me, including the faces we are passing by…
